entry.title: Learn to implement Financial Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and get certified.
entry.content:
I  recommend to access our Implementing Financial Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud learning journey.

Learning objectives

  • Set up and execute the business processes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for:
    •  Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Implementing Record-to-Report
    • Implementing Receivables Management
    • Implementing Payables Management
    • Implementing Asset Accounting
    • Understand the fundamental administrative duties within SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing.
Learning journey goals
  • Get started with SAP - Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise - Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise - Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Start here and check out these recommended resources.
  • You can find a link to the required prior knowledge within each specific course.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Approval of Time posted on WBS Element
entry.content:
Hello @maik1860 

Thank you for your question.

For time sheet approvals in S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition, use the Team Type TSH_APPR in the Manage Teams and Responsibilities app. This team setup works with scope item J11 - Time Recording and is used by the workflow for time approval.

Could you please ensure the workflow is active in Manage Workflows for Time Recording? Check below Approving Your Employees' Time Sheet Requests  and Manage My Timesheet 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Missing 'Public' checkbox in VariantManagement – UI5 app with P13n
entry.content:
@FabioPagoti

I checked the UI5 version on my system: the SAP_UI component version is 754, and when checking via the URL /sap/public/bc/ui5_ui5/index.html, the UI5 version displayed is 1.71 (1.71.55). To meet the requirements of my application, I need at least UI5 version 1.120, so I’m using the UI5 bootstrap to load a newer version manually.

The problem is that when using the bootstrap version, I cannot properly integrate the app into the Fiori Launchpad. Interestingly, saving user-specific variants still works. Specifically, Variant Management does not behave as expected: The USER layer is saved correctly in the backend. I can see logs in transaction SLG1 with object /UIF/LREP. However, the PUBLIC layer is not even displayed. I assume this issue is caused by the version mismatch between the manually loaded UI5 bootstrap version (1.120+) and the UI5 version of the system (1.71).

entry.title: Are you prepared using the SAP Business Transformation Center (BTC) effectively?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Unlocking Change with SAP Business Transformation Center learning journey.

Overview
Welcome to a new era of Data Transformation! This Learning Journey introduces you to the SAP Business Transformation Center, a cloud-based SaaS solution designed to streamline and optimize data transformation projects. Fully integrated with SAP Cloud ALM and powered by the SAP Business Technology Platform, it supports organizations in their journey toward digital modernization. Develop a comprehensive understanding of the Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA approach and its benefits using SAP Business Transformation Center. Learn which prerequisites are necessary and finally, gain insights into scoping, modeling, cycle and monitoring phase of a Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA with SAP Business Transformation.

Learning objectives
After completing this learning journey, you will be able to evaluate the benefits of SAP Business Transformation Center for planning, analyzing and executing a Lean Selective Data Transition Project. You can define the necessary prerequisites and preparations steps that are needed to use SAP Business Transformation Center. In addition, you learn how to use SAP Business Transformation Center in the scoping, modeling, cycle and monitoring phase of a Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Use the new “Driven by AI” Attribute in the SAP SuccessFactors Process Library (SSPL)
entry.content:
Why the “Driven by AI” Attribute Matters

As organizations strive to become more intelligent and data-driven, understanding where AI is infused in business processes is critical. With the “Driven by AI” attribute, SSPL users can quickly identify AI-supported processes, making it easier to leverage innovative solutions for better decision-making and operational efficiency.

Examples of AI-Infused Processes

Some examples of processes now marked with the “Driven by AI” attribute include:

  • Plan Career: AI-Assisted Career Insights
  • Review Performance: AI-Assisted Writing in SAP SuccessFactors Applications
  • Conduct 360 Degree Review: AI-Assisted Insights into Detailed 360 Report
  • Execute LTI Review: AI-Assisted Person Insights for Compensation Discussions

Explore the Updates

Use Signavio Collaboration Hub to easily see which processes and activities are impacted by AI: select the process and make sure to have the overlay “Driven by AI” selected. If you click on the activity, it will also give you additional information about the type of AI used, as shown below.

entry.title: EEO Self ID During ONB
entry.content:
Hello,

We are in the process of moving from SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding 1.0 # to SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding #. For our U.S.-based employees who participate in EEO-1 filing, we’re looking for a solution to enable self-disclosure of Race/Ethnicity/Gender post-offer.

In Onboarding 1.0, we had implemented a custom panel that included the required EEO language and mapped the data into Employee Central (EC). In Onboarding 2.0, new hires now enter this information directly into EC fields—but the EEO language is no longer present.

I've attached a screenshot showing how the panel appeared in ONB 1.0. While we understand that a custom form can be created in ONB 2.0, we’ve learned that data from such forms cannot be mapped into EC.

Has anyone implemented a solution or best practice for this scenario in your organization? We’d appreciate any guidance or examples you can share.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: DME file splitting based on amount threshold
entry.content:
Hi Anuja - Solution will work like this...

Step 1- DME (XML file is created.

Step 2 - File is stored in AL11 folder.

Step 3 - PI/PO will interface this file via encryption format to Bank (API Call).

Step 4. Bank will consume the entire file with various amounts.

Step 5- Bank will trigger workflow - allocate the file to respective approvers based on the amount logic built.

Step 6 - Approvers will login into bank site and approve the file allotted to their ids. 

Hope this helps.

Best,

entry.title: Re: Custom CDS Views - FAQ
entry.content:
Hello Roman, @roman_mozil 

no, Custom CDS Views as a Key User app is restricted to using C1 released CDS Views (SAP Virtual Data Model VDM) as Data Sources. Tables are not on the roadmap.

Best Regards
Andreas

entry.title: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on their Area.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need help in allocating cost per customer based on their Area based on same company code, plant and profitcenter.

I have two models:

  • Cost Model (Source):
    Dimensions: Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center
    Measure: Amount

  • Revenue Model (Driver):
    Dimensions: Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center, Customer
    Measure: Area

I want to allocate the Amount from the Cost Model to customers using the Area from the Revenue Model as the driver. The allocation should be proportional based on Area.

The final output should assign each cost line item from the Cost Model (identified by Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center) to one or more Customers, such that the total Amount is fully distributed across customers based on their share of the Area within the same dimensional intersection (Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center).

My input data : Cost Model

Revenue Model : 

After Allocation , I want each customer which is K1 to K4 should repeat for each GL account G1 and G2 and than , the Allocated cost should be calculated as

Allocation Logic

  • For each GL Account (e.g., G1 and G2), and for each Customer (K1 to K4):
    • Allocate cost proportionally based on Area.
    • Formula:

Allocated Cost= Amount× Area / Sum of Area​

 

Desired O/p: Final Output I am expecting

Can you please let me know how we can do it using Data Action in SAP Analytics cloud. 

 

@N1kh1l  : Can you please share your expert advice on this as well ?.

entry.title: SAP IRPA/BPA Excel formulas not calculated when cell values set by bot
entry.content:
Hi, I am facing issue as per the subject. I need to pass dates from SAP to prepared excel where it does some calculations. When I enter the dates (to cells that are formatted as date), these excel formulas (instead of getting correct values) are giving me 04.01.1900. I thought it could be some format issue when taking data from SAP. But even when I try to get and manipulate values only within excel, it does the same. As a last resort I tried to reenter these formulas. So after I set cell B2 and C2 with date I put formula to column I2. result is still the same. When setting these B2, C2 cells as a user, everything gets calculated correctly. Is there any fix for that? Thank you.

Edit: looks like root cause is the format with formula combination. Formulas like =IF etc are calcaulted. Formula =MAX(D2:D16) not. I can see by testing the value inserted by bot with =ISNUMBER is false but when entered by human it returns true. So need to find out how to pass values to excel in correct format probably?

entry.title: Re: How to Dynamically Change the Task Title in Workflow Notifications?
entry.content:
Hello,

From functional perspective, you can set dynamic variables only in Maintain Email Templates app. And that will influence how the title/content will look in user's Outlook Inbox.

The title which you see in My Inbox app is set automatically by the system depending which workflow ID you have configured for your custom email template.

You can try to create an SAP ticket to get the official opinion from product experts of this matter.

entry.title: Re: EHS Risk Assessment Master Data
entry.content:
Dear Simran,

based on the specific module/process, there is a different set of master data required to get the process running. As there might be more data needed from other modules, I'm only going to elaborate on the EHS-specific master data.

EHS Incident Management

For the end-to-end process for EHS Incident Management, the master data required is the so-called EHS Location object. The location specifies where the incident happened. I described how the location structure might look like in another post. From an incident management point of view, it's a best practice to keep the location structure short and crisp - this is to make sure that employees reporting incidents are not overwhelmed by hundreds of thousands of options to choose from. In addition to the place the incident happened, the so-called Incident Manager (responsible to review and complete the created incident record) is determined by the location, too. The locations and the overall location structure can be edited/display in the app Manage Locations.

EHS Operational Risk Assessment

For the end-to-end process for EHS Incident Management, the master data includes the so-called EHS Location, too. In the context of an operational risk assessment, the location describes the place a risk/hazard is observed. Examples in this context are both, physical locations (e. g. a workplace), or a more activity-based approach (e. g. an activity performed). Typically, the overall location structure for the operational risk assessment process must be more detailed than the one required for the incident management process.

In addition, the so-called EHS Job will be required for job-based risk assessments (named as JHA in standard). The job is a kind of activity performed, e. g. Welding, Office Work, Driving, etc. The jobs can be edited/display in the app Manage Jobs.

Furthermore, Controls will be required to mitigate identified risks. The controls are stored in a control catalog and usually organized in a STOP principle (Substitution, Technical, Organizational, Personal). The control master data itself is structured by a control type, control subtype, and control catalog (all of these are configuration). The controls can be edited/displayed in the app Manage Controls.

If you are looking to perform an operational risk assessment for chemical substances, the EHS Chemical object is required. The chemicals can be edited/displayed in the app Manage Chemicals. The chemicals are itself part of subprocesses, such as the Chemical Approval process. Similarly, other sorts of Agents (Airborne and Physical), can be assessed, too.

Finally, there are Risk Identification Templates and Assessment Profiles which can be classified as master data, too. As there are several master data objects and configuration involved, there is a nice schema on help.sap.com available describing the objects in more detail.

Management of Change

There is no master data which has to be set up inside of MOC. The reason is that MOC refers to other modules, such as Plant Maintenance, to link to. Therefore, the master data will originate from other modules. As an example, a MOC Change Request may refer to an PM Functional Location, PM Equipment, DMS Document, or MM Material, amongst others. Another more functional reason for the lack of its own master data is that MOC is used to orchestrate a process

Audit Management (CA-AUD)

No master data required inside of the tool.

With kind regards,

Michael

entry.title: Exciting News for Our Learners: Introducing Live Translated Captions!
entry.content:
What Does This Mean for You?

Imagine being able to participate in our engaging live sessions, regardless of your native language. With this new feature, you can select subtitles in your preferred language and dive into a seamless multilingual learning experience. Whether you are tuning in from Beijing, Berlin, or Buenos Aires, our goal is to create an environment where language is no longer a barrier to learning.

How It Works:

During our live sessions, English audio is accompanied by real-time subtitles translated into multiple languages. Simply choose your language from the options available and enjoy the session with clear understanding and enhanced comprehension.

Why You'll Love This Feature:

  1. Enhanced Accessibility: Breaking down language barriers allows more learners to benefit from our diverse offerings, fostering an inclusive community.
  2. Improved Comprehension: Understanding complex topics is easier when content is delivered in your preferred language. Our translated captions provide the clarity you need to fully grasp the material.
  3. Global Inclusivity: Celebrate diversity and unity by connecting with learners from around the world. Share ideas and perspectives, and build a network that transcends linguistic boundaries.

Explore Our Live Sessions:

Our live sessions cover a wide range of topics that cater to different interests and professional goals. From cutting-edge technology trends to Expert Deep Dive sessions and Get Certified sessions, there’s something for everyone. Find the complete schedule and session details on our website.

Join us in embracing a future where learning knows no borders. Dive into our live sessions with translated captions and enrich your educational journey today!

Happy Learning!

entry.title: Re: Deployments without passwords with SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have followed the below steps ended with  below error message.  Please advise.

info  cloudFoundryDeploy - "error":"invalid_grant","error_description":"User authentication failed: SP_INTERNAL_ACCESS_ONLY"

 

  • The tech user created in this case techUser@example.com has to be added as a "Space Developer" with the email and using the proper origin, i.e <ias tenant>-platform or the name you've chosen depending on the trust configuration.
  • The user techUser@example.com has to be created in IAS and in our case had a fictitious email, so we had to manually set "Verify Email" in the corresponding checkbox (details tab of the user in IAS) otherwise we got an error "User Authentication failed: MAIL_NOT_VERIFIED")
  • In our case we use IAS as a proxy to our corporate IDP. In the configuration of the BTP Cockpit app in IAS we're passing an IDP attribute as "Subject Name Identifier" and we were not using a fallback attribute because it was currently not needed for the current scenario. In this authentication scenario for CICD, the user created only exist locally in IAS and not in our IDP so we had to add the Email from IAS as fallback similar as mentioned in 3568567 otherwise we got error "

entry.title: SF EC to s/4 HANA Integration - BADI for OM object
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

entry.title: Re: Comparison BO publication VS SAC publication

In SAC, You can schedule both formats but not in the same schedule. You might have to create 2 different schedules as it allows only a single format to be chosen in schedule option.

 

Hope this helps

Nikhil

entry.title: How Generative AI & LLMs Are Redefining UI Creation
entry.content:
Introduction to User Interfaces (UI)

User interfaces (UI) are everywhere. From simple command-line terminals to mobile layouts, user interfaces (UI) exist to turn abstract goals: “send this message,” “book that flight,” and “pay this friend”—into visible controls that anyone can understand immediately. 

Currently, at startups and smaller companies, designers pass static mock-ups to developers, who then translate every layer into HTML, CSS, and JS, checking each line against accessibility rules and responsive breakpoints. At larger organizations and enterprises like SAP, designers use no-code and low-code systems like SAP Design System or SAP Build Apps, where users can drag and drop widgets to create websites and UI in general. 

With the recent advance of deep-learning systems and generative AI, especially large-language models like ChatGPT, Gemini, or Claude, promising to disrupt various areas, the ripple effects are also beginning to reach the world of user interfaces. Products like v0 (Vercel), Lovable, or Galileo AI are transforming the UI field, especially in rapid prototyping and iteration cases. 

Could we use AI to build user interfaces for tens of thousands of customers? Could we create production-ready user interfaces in less than a minute? What is the future of UI and design? How does SAP approach the problem of UI generation?

We will find answers to these complex but essential questions. 

The Status Quo – problems with UI and where traditional approaches fail 

Today, most development teams at large enterprises choose between two approaches for UI:

  1. Hand-coded UI (HTML/CSS/JS/React, etc.) – complete control and top-tier performance/accessibility, but slow, designer-dependent, and hard to keep on schedule when scope shifts. 

  2. No-code & low-code builders (SAP Build Work Zone, Bubble, Wix) – faster and less technical, yet they lock you into auto-generated code, hurt scalability/integration, and limit customization. 

Here are some major pain points developers face when designing a UI using the first approach (hand-coded): 

  • Design gaps & inconsistency: non-designers copy-paste styles, creating a mismatched look and feel. 

  • Slow, siloed workflow: every tweak bounces between design, development, and QA. 

  • Poor usability: unclear flows complicate tasks for users. 

  • Fragmented standards: missing design systems introduce visual/behavioral drift. 

  • Weak SEO: sloppy markup and absent metadata/discoverability.

What if we could prevent these tradeoffs? Let’s briefly examine our existing team’s work, the SAP Build Work Zone, and the Builder tool.

Introducing SAP Build Work Zone 

SAP Build Work Zone is a digital experience platform that enables organizations to create personalized, role-based access to business applications, processes, and content—all from a single unified interface. It uses a no-code solution with a drag-and-drop interface for website design. 

Specifically, Work Zone utilizes a grid system for website layout and widgets (tiles, cards, text, search, rotating banner, etc.) to customize your website. Here is an example of an already live SAP Build Work Zone website:


Here you can see the editor window: 

What if you could design these user interfaces without requiring drag-and-drop or code? Could you create these webpages using natural language (NL) and text? Could it be completed within a minute or less? We invite you to explore our solution to the problem: the UI Builder and the team behind it.

 Our team & SAP Build Work Zone UI Builder 

We are a Research and Innovation team and we’re excited to introduce one of our prototypes, SAP Build Work Zone UI Builder, a tool designed to bring intelligent assistance and enhanced productivity to UI development within SAP Build Work Zone.

The Builder is an intelligent assistant that helps users create compliant, visually consistent websites within SAP Build Workzone using natural language. It describes the widgets you want to have (carousels, cards, images) and the use case (forum, FAQ page, representational website, etc.).

The Builder works like this: 

  1. Users would visit a website. 
  2. In the text field, the user would enter a prompt: Build a team website for research and innovation for discussion and documentation
  3. You would get a generated UI template like this: 

The generated template has different widgets in place to implement the described use case: search, welcome banner, quick links, and history. 

If you want to see it in action, check out this video presentation by our team: https://video.sap.com/media/t/1_6mt84kct.

What about the Future?

As a famous computer scientist named Alan Kay said, “The best way to predict the future is to invent it.”  Inspired by this mindset, we see multiple paths to expanding and evolving our solution beyond its current capabilities. We could improve the project through features such as:  

  • Visual Prompting. Create user interfaces from images or hand-written notes.  
  • Multi-language support: German, Spanish, or French.  
  • Agents. One agent could understand user needs, another generates a template, and the last applies accessibility and responsiveness.  
  • Interactive conversations. They would allow edits and improvements to the generated template. 

Let’s also discuss scale and impact. The potential to scale it beyond SAP is enormous. According to Siteefy, roughly 252,000 new websites come online every day—that is almost 92 million websites a year!

General benefits for small and large companies are huge: weeks of developer time redeemed, employee productivity increased through better design and faster iteration, and long-term maintenance costs cut by shipping clean, standards-compliant code from day one. These advantages empower businesses to scale efficiently and stay competitive in a rapidly evolving AI landscape.

entry.title: A Maior Edição do SAP Inside Track no Brasil está Chegando – Não deixe de anotar as agendas!
entry.content:
Prepare-se para fazer parte de um marco na comunidade SAP no Brasil! O SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025 promete ser a maior e melhor edição já realizada no país, reunindo especialistas, profissionais e entusiastas de SAP em um dia repleto de conteúdo de altíssimo nível, networking e inovação.

O SAP Inside Track (SIT) é um evento global, organizado por membros da própria comunidade SAP, que acontece em várias cidades do mundo. No Brasil, ele vem ganhando força ano após ano e em 2025, São Paulo será palco da edição mais completa de todas! Com trilhas paralelas para áreas Funcional e de Desenvolvimento (Dev), o evento cobre tudo: desde planejamento orçamentário e transformação digital com IA até segurança em nuvem e ABAP moderno.

Data: 26 de Julho de 2025

Local: PUC Consolação - São Paulo/SP

Não deixe de anotar as agendas completas das trilhas FUNCTIONAL e DEVELOPERS – organizadas com muito cuidado para atender a todas as áreas e interesses. São dezenas de palestras relevantes ao longo de um dia inteiro de imersão em SAP.

Nos vemos no #SITSP2025!

🟦 #SITSP2025FUNC – Trilha Funcional

Horário Palestra

entry.title: Re: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on t...
entry.content:
@abhimanyu_sharma 

Sorry but I couldn't understand your tables

Is Area a dimension or Measure, seems to be a measure and the allocation driver.

Also not sure how in second table you have both Amount and Allocated cost. Create a single table with pre allocated and post allocated data. Also provide data in terms of exact dimensions and measure as no one in community will know your exact data model.

On a higher level it just looks a weighted ratio of Area allocation.

So you could use a variable member for Area to get the grand total. Then get the ratio by dividing each area value by this variable member value. Finally you can multiply this ratio by the original amount to be allocated.

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Resource Purchase & Consumption IFP Product Costing
entry.content:
Hi @SANA11 ,

implementing the logic “Purchase = (Consumption + Target Closing Inventory) – Opening Inventory” is not possible in the standard IFP content.

One possibility would be to add a Flow_Type dimension to the Product Cost model.  The members could be as below:  

The planning story would need to have the functionality for the user to input the desired Target Closing Inventory.

Consumption would be calculated per the standard method.

Opening inventory would need to be entered or imported from S/4HANA.  The standard IFP content only imports opening balances for financial amounts, not quantity.

A straightforward data action (similar to the balance sheet calculations in the Financial Statement) could then calculate the Purchases.

It must be noted that adding the Flow_Type dimension to the Product Cost model is a significant change and the effect on each data action and story needs to be considered.  Further details would require consulting services. 

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Reflection: Are people answering questions using ChatGPT helping the Community?
entry.content:
In my opinion, GenAI answers not proven to work should not be permitted. We all have access to GenAI to provide answers using that method, so we do not need that pasted into user-based support forums. I believe most other technical forums are following this approach and have a strong aversion for untested GenAI answers.

However, this conversation is bigger than just encouraging users to admit GenAI usage, as permitting GenAI answers in user forums negatively impacts the overall process of searching for high-quality answers.

As context, when looking for an answer to a problem, "high-quality" answers are:

  1. Known working solutions provided by knowledgeable users with additional context about the environment (so you can match or adapt it to your own).
  2. Suggested answers and considerations by knowledgeable users based on their real experience and tailored to the question-asker's environment.
  3. Additional information or questions informed by real challenges other users have encountered in their real environments.

GenAI answers do not reliably meet any of these criteria and often are incorrect, requiring knowledgeable users to make significant changes before the initial GenAI answer will work.

However, incorrect GenAI answers will still return as results when searching, because 1) it is showing up on SAP forums (a useful place for high-quality answers) and 2) it will contain many similarities to the search (even though it is incorrect).

Further, the real AI slop-fest begins when GenAIs refer to these copy-pasted hallucinations to generate future hallucinations (which users will also copy and paste into the forums), making finding good, high-quality answers exponentially harder... eventually requiring some kind of trust-factor score (and then we're basically recreating stack overflow).

For myself, while I do use GenAI for the practical aspect of solution-finding, I immediately disregard publicly posted answers that I believe are based on GenAI, because I cannot confirm if these answers are based on real users or real environments.

If someone wants to suggest "I faced this problem previously, and used GenAI with the following prompt parameters to find the answer", or "the following is a confirmed working solution that I used GenAI to create", these are fine, as they still require the user to have tested the result.

entry.title: Re: MIGO BADI in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @yashoratna .

I have implemented and successfully triggered two BADIs in the standard app Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document that might be very useful for your case:

MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA – triggered when entering or changing a purchasing document in the standard app Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document. You can use it to modify data at both header and item levels.

MMIM_GR4XY_CHECK_DATA – triggered when posting the purchasing document. You can use it to perform validations and raise messages if needed.



Follow these steps to implement these BADIs:


1. Go to the Custom Logic app
2. Create a new implementation
3. Search by BADI ID "MMIM_GR4XY" or by Business Context "Inventory Management: Goods Receipt for Fiori apps"


4. Select the BADI you want to implement
5. Write your validation or enhancement logic and publish it

BR,
Alexandre

entry.title: Re: Forward propagation not working when importing pay ra...
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes, this is normal behavior in SAP SuccessFactors. When you import new pay ranges (or other changes) with retroactive (back-dated) effective dates, forward propagation does not always occur—especially if there are already future-dated records that create a "break" or a value mismatch in the relevant field. Forward propagation in Employee Central typically stops when a future record already exists with a different value or when a manually-maintained change for that field has occurred at a future effective date

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Publishing Custom Field "New Grade" from SAP SuccessF...
entry.content:
Hi @RavindraSharma 

As far as I know at this time publishing information back to Job Info is only possible when Promotion is enabled on the worksheet (= fields are edited from the promotion popup). Which means I am not sure your design will work here.

The xml code is as follows, it needs to be at the bottom of the publish back block (after anything for compInfo, recurring PC and non-reccuring PC). Note that the comp-hris-field-map block with customField2 in it is only if you want to customize the date to be different based on a specific attribute : you build a custom column in design worksheet with a lookup table and use that as publish back date).

entry.title: Re: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on t...
entry.content:
@abhimanyu_sharma 

Assuming you have copied data from Cost and revenue model into the final model and the data looks like below.

 

Something like below could work. Adjust accordingly as per you dimensions and measures names.

VARIABLEMEMBER #TOTAL_CUSTOMER OF [d/CUSTOMER]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUST OF [d/CUSTOMER]
VARIABLEMEMBER #GL OF [d/GLACCOUNT]


DATA([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area",[d/GLACCOUNT]="#")


DATA([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")

// Copying Amount to all customers

DATA([d/Measures]="Amount")= (RESULTLOOKUP([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area")*0+1) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)

// Copying Area to all customers

DATA([d/Measures]="Area")= RESULTLOOKUP([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area") * (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)*0+1)

// Calculating Allocated Cost in ratio of Area against all customers

DATA([d/CUSTOMER]=#TOTAL_CUSTOMER,[d/Measures]="Area")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area")

DATA([d/Measures]="Allocated Cost")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area") / RESULTLOOKUP([d/CUSTOMER]=#TOTAL_CUSTOMER,[d/Measures]="Area") * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")

//Reversing the Original Amount

DATA([d/Measures]="Amount")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")* -1 // This will be a problem if allocation is run in iterations as you will lose original amount

Also reversing the original pre allocated amount of 1000 and 2000 is not advisable as it modifies the original amount to be allocated and will create problems if you run this multiple times. Store the reversal offset against different account may be.

Also you might have to delete original area values if required. The reason I have not deleted as its original copied values from revenue model so handle accordingly.

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Unable to Edit a Custom Field under one-time payments
entry.content:
Hello!

We have a requirement to create a custom field under One-Time Payments. The field’s visibility is set to "Edit" in the Business Configuration UI. We’ve also assigned an onChange business rule that should make the field editable only when a specific pay component is selected.

To verify the rule behavior, we enabled rule trace, which confirms that the condition is working correctly. When the correct pay component is selected, the rule sets the field’s visibility to "both". The trace shows:

Set property 'payComponentNonRecurringModel.payComponentNonRecurring_custom_string1.visibility' to value 'both' in modified object 'custom-string1'

However, in the UI, the field custom-string1 is not editable. It only appears under the “View Empty Fields” section on the right panel, and not in the main editable area.

We recently enabled the latest People Profile, and we’re wondering if there’s an additional configuration step required to make the field editable and visible in the main UI.

Any inputs are greatly appreciated.

-Swathi
